Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Civil Service and Labor

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Oversight - Survivors State of Health - Health of 9/11 Responders and the Surrounding Community.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Survivors State of Health - Health of 9/11 Responders and the Surrounding Community.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of the City of New York to grant sick leave to all civilian officers and employees of the City of New York seeking treatment for a qualifying World Trade Center condition.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Calling upon the Mayor of NYC to grant sick leave to all civilian officers and employees of NYC seeking treatment for a qualifying World Trade Center condition.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Miller, Adams, Dromm and Maisel

Items.Title: Oversight - Survivors State of Health - Health of 9/11 Responders and the Surrounding Community.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Survivors State of Health - Health of 9/11 Responders and the Surrounding Community.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of the City of New York to grant sick leave to all civilian officers and employees of the City of New York seeking treatment for a qualifying World Trade Center condition.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Calling upon the Mayor of NYC to grant sick leave to all civilian officers and employees of NYC seeking treatment for a qualifying World Trade Center condition.
